abstract.shortdesc: Breadcrumbs are the links that show the ancestry of a topic in a hierarchy. In interactive output, clicking on a breadcrumb link usually takes the reader to that ancestor topic. For each topic, the plus-preprocess-breadcrumbs plugin generates related links to each topic that is a direct ancestor of it in the map.
abstract.p: A set of breadcrumb links is generated for a topic by consulting the map that contains a reference to that topic. Links to that topic's parent, grandparent, and so on are added to a link pool for that topic.<linkpool role="ancestor"> <link href="top-level-topic.xml" role="anceator"/> <!-- As many levels as needed go here. --> <link href="grandparentparent-topic.xml" role="ancestor"/> <link href="parent-topic.xml" role="ancestor"/> </linkpool>If a topic appears in more than one place in the hierarchy, a set of breadcrumb links will be generated for each ancestry.

row.entry: Set to yes if breadcrumb related links should be generated. Passed to the maplink stylesheet as the parameter BREADCRUMBS.
